info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 16 at 10:54PM CDT until May 16 at 11:15PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 PM CDT FOR FOARD...NORTHWESTERN KNOX AND HARDEMAN COUNTIES... At 1054 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 3 miles east of Kirkland to 13 miles east of Swearingen to 11 miles northwest of Truscott, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Quanah, Crowell, Goodlett, Truscott, Margaret, Copper Breaks State Park and Lazare. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
